article: Mr Brown lives in Sydney. His house is about five kilometers  away from  his office and the bus can  _  him there. He likes football very much and wants to  watch  the football matches. His wife likes to buy nice clothes and  _  her husband give all his wages to her and he has to do  _  she says. Then she always  _  some fares back to him. Of course Mr Brown doesn't have any money to buy the  _  . One evening he went to watch a football match. He bought a ticket  _  all his money and he  _  to go home  _  foot. When he  got  home, he was tired, but felt  _  . Since then he began to go to work on foot. But he is  _  to tell his wife about it. This morning when he was having breakfast, he  _  a piece of news over the radio: the bus fares were going to  _  in price. He hurried to turn it  _  , but it was too  _  . His wife asked, "What did the radio say?" He had to  _  her all he heard. Then he became sad and said, " What a Pity!" "You must be happy, I think," said his wife. "You will save some  _  ." "Sorry, I can't  _  with you." said Mr Brown. "I won't be able to watch two matches a month!"
